title: People reporting for off meta picks
body:
So, I just got auto filled and played a game of Xerath as support. Xerath has pretty much a 30% role rate as support, so I didn’t think much of it. The first game, someone says, “I’m not dealing with Xerath supp” and dodges. Great. Next game, nothing happens. Until I get first kill. I have a sivir adc, and they ignite a thresh walking away. This was only about 2-3 minutes into the game, so ignite only did around 70/90 true damage. I saw the thresh had 150hp, and it wouldn’t have killed him, so I q him and he dies. Here’s what follows:
Sivir: ks
GavinTFI: he wouldn’t have died
Sivir: s7fu
GavinTFI: lulw
So, I continued as normal. We played about 1 minute later when I w’d a group of minions (maybe 5 minions) and sivir says, “I’m done ur garbage xerath fuc kyou”
He leaves. Great.
I ask the enemy team and my team to report him, and to which I get a response by the enemy Olaf saying, “why?” I say, “leaving and toxic” 
Enemy adc says, “report yourself for picking xerath support”
Enemy support says, “^ lol”
I say, “report yourself for inting then lul”
So, I continue in lane 1v2ing the enemies, getting fed, and carrying. They end up ffing and I got a satisfying victory and a fat report on sivir. 

TL;DR: my adc leaves because I play xerath support and carry. I ask if the enemy will report sivir for leaving and they tell me to report myself for playing xerath support

Point is, why do people hate off meta picks so much? I’ve played xerath support 3 times now; each time getting no less than an s-. My adc leaves and the enemies trash talk me because I choose a very good and viable character. Note: this isn’t high mmr and it’s in draft pick normal. I’m only level 36 (leveled up because of this game). This probably wouldn’t happen in like a diamond game but still, you get my point. Thanks for reading, and if you’ve ever done this, please say why. {{champion:101}} :)

If you are support you should always start with a gold income item, no matter what champion you are playing.

Since you're new, you might not understand that supports should always take a gold income item first and only take cs while laning under very specific circumstances (last hitting if the minion would otherwise die without being farmed by adc, shoving the wave under enemy tower if your adc is dead or recalled to take away farm from enemies, etc.). Every cs does matter to your adc. This is why you need to take a gold income item; adcs get income from cs and kills, and supps get income from their gold income item and assists.

Because people are idiots. As you get 'further' in the game there will be less of an obsession with ks'ing. Play what you want and ignore them. 

As far as the report, it doesn't matter. It's not going to count for anything since you didn't do anything wrong.

Lastly, keep in mind there is only one report needed to have the system review a game. Getting 9 reports does the same as 1. You're better off never asking for a report because if you do it excessively in a game, it can be viewed as 'negative attitude' and get you punished.

The problem is that people nowadays report for anything but truth is that if you know the rules you won't get punished. You picked a champ you wanted to play, you played it in a role he's not very popular in. So what? you didn't feed and even if you did poorly, as long as you didn't go something like 0/15 building AD or full tank you're not trying to lose the game. If picking a champ in an off role was against the rules we'd have positional exclusivity for the roles you get assigned as. People nowadays think they can only ever have fun if they win and pick the most meta shit. And that's Riot's fault for pushing that over-competitive nature by promoting Esports for so long. Now no one ever plays for fun and people become toxic as hell once someone doesn't play up to their unrealistic standards like they're good at the game or something.

TLDR: As long as you don't actually break any rules, play whatever the hell you want and pay no mind to anyone claiming to be reporting you, because you know you haven't done anything wrong.
all you're doing is screwing over your team and they should embrace the loss and thank you

I suggest you don't go asking for reports, as it is considered a mild harassment and continuously doing so will get you punished.
